授業目的: This course is designed to help students learn the fundamentals of international business strategies and cross-cultural management. As increasing number of companies are expanding their operations globally, the importance of international management has significantly increased in recent years. We need to understand the people of different cultures, the way they do business, and secrets to success in international business. This course will address these issues by expanding our knowledge about employees, management, and organizational behavior to encompass the entire world.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:

a) use the fundamental vocabulary and theoretical frameworks to understand the management of business in international environment.

b) understand how to work with people from different cultural backgrounds.

c) learn how to manage organizations, processes, and people in other countries.

d) develop an awareness of how to incorporate ethical principles, personal and organizational values, and socially responsible practices in international management.

e) enhance their abilities to participate in interactive class environment and work in small teams.
特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
This course will be offered in face-to-face format from the first lecture.

This class will be distributed as "Simultaneous two-way class via ZOOM". Necessary materials for the class will be available on LUNA.
